text: a tense morning in Borno after several
attacks overnight we are onboard our
military convoy living behind the
relative safety of my childhood home the
state capital my degree and heading
towards the militants our goal is to
reach the sambisa forest the heart of
the Boko Haram insurgency when I was
reporting from here in 2013 Boko Haram
had a firm grip on the northeast the
nature of the conflict has now changed
the group has been pushed out of towns
and villages they once controlled they
no longer have the means to launch
conventional attacks and rely on IEDs
and suicide bombers this is or this was
quandra once a busy market town now
utterly devastated last year my
neighbors here were attacked over and
over more than 20 times until those who
survived fled for their lives we wanted
to talk to some residents about their
experiences but there is no one left
next stop the army base built on the
main road to my degree it is protected
on all fronts even here there is no room
for complacency the compound has been
attacked several times and these
soldiers have buried many of their
colleagues as the troops
